alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 2:50PM CST until December 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing drizzle and a flash freeze will lead to icy conditions. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. * WHERE...Columbia and Union Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, 6 PM CST this evening until Noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could significantly impact travel, especially where freezing rain initially develops. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
